title: Working with REST APIs to access spatial data

markdown.headingText: Working with REST APIs to access spatial data
markdown.markdown:
![](figures/ace-frehley.png){.absolute top=100 left=25 width="3in"}

## Example: AGOL query

Get US Census TIGER/line data using AGOL query in the browser

![](figures/agol-query-gui.png){width="85%"}

## Example: AGOL query

Return GeoJSON

```json
{
  "type": "FeatureCollection",
  "features": [
    {
      "type": "Feature",
      "geometry": {
        "type": "Polygon",
        "coordinates": [
          [
            [-111.737567999652, 40.5282020000119],
            ...,
            [-111.737567999652, 40.5282020000119]
          ]
        ]
      },
      "properties": {
        "NAME": "Salt Lake County"
      }
    }
  ]
}
```

## Example: AGOL query

Read to simple feature

```r
library(sf)

long_geojson_string <- '({"type":"FeatureCollection", ... "NAME":"Salt Lake County"}}]}'

slco <- read_sf(long_geojson_string)
```

## {.center}

![](figures/agol-query-gui.gif){fig-align="center"}

## Example: `arcgislayers`

Get US Census TIGER/line data using `arcgislayers` in R

```{r}
library(arcgislayers)

# connect to a map service
url <- file.path(
  "https://tigerweb.geo.census.gov/arcgis/rest/services",
  "TIGERweb",
  "State_County",
  "MapServer",
  "1"
)

service <- arc_open(url)

# write and execute http request
slco <- arc_select(service, where = "NAME='Salt Lake County'")
```

## Why care?

Focus on remote access data...

1. makes data used for research more accessible,
2. shifts focus from data management to data processing,
3. reduces the need for costly data duplication, 
4. supports collaborative research, and 
5. promotes reproducibility.
